trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery coordinates the replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines and physical servers located on on-premises to Azure or to a secondary on-premises site.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery coordinates the replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines and physical servers located on on-premises to Azure or to a secondary on-premises site.

trans-unit.source: The Site Recovery service contributes to a robust business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) solution that protects your on-premises physical servers and virtual machines by orchestrating and automating replication and failover to Azure, or to a secondary on-premises datacenter.
trans-unit.target: The Site Recovery service contributes to a robust business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) solution that protects your on-premises physical servers and virtual machines by orchestrating and automating replication and failover to Azure, or to a secondary on-premises datacenter.

trans-unit.source: Simplify-Site Recovery helps simplify your BCDR strategy by making it easy to configure replication, and run failover and recovery for your on-premises workloads and applications.
trans-unit.target: Simplify-Site Recovery helps simplify your BCDR strategy by making it easy to configure replication, and run failover and recovery for your on-premises workloads and applications.

trans-unit.source: Replication-You can replicate on-premises workloads to Azure storage, or to a secondary datacenter.
trans-unit.target: Replication-You can replicate on-premises workloads to Azure storage, or to a secondary datacenter.

trans-unit.source: Vault-To manage replication you set up a Site Recovery vault in an Azure region you select.
trans-unit.target: Vault-To manage replication you set up a Site Recovery vault in an Azure region you select.

trans-unit.source: All metadata remains within that region.
trans-unit.target: All metadata remains within that region.

trans-unit.source: Metadata-No application data is send to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Metadata-No application data is send to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Site Recovery only needs metadata such as virtual machine and VMM cloud names, in order to orchestrate replication and failover.
trans-unit.target: Site Recovery only needs metadata such as virtual machine and VMM cloud names, in order to orchestrate replication and failover.

trans-unit.source: Connection to Azure-Management servers communicate with Azure depending on your deployment scenario.
trans-unit.target: Connection to Azure-Management servers communicate with Azure depending on your deployment scenario.

trans-unit.source: For example if you're replicating virtual machines located in an on-premises VMM cloud, the VMM server communicates with Site Recovery over an encrypted outbound HTTPS connection.
trans-unit.target: For example if you're replicating virtual machines located in an on-premises VMM cloud, the VMM server communicates with Site Recovery over an encrypted outbound HTTPS connection.

trans-unit.source: No connection is required from the virtual machines or Hyper-V hosts.
trans-unit.target: No connection is required from the virtual machines or Hyper-V hosts.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Replica-Azure Site Recovery leverages Hyper-V Replica for the replication process, and can also use SAN replication if you're replicating between two on-premises VMM sites.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Replica-Azure Site Recovery leverages Hyper-V Replica for the replication process, and can also use SAN replication if you're replicating between two on-premises VMM sites.

trans-unit.source: Site Recovery uses smart replication, replicating only data blocks and not the entire VHD for the initial replication.
trans-unit.target: Site Recovery uses smart replication, replicating only data blocks and not the entire VHD for the initial replication.

trans-unit.source: For ongoing replication only delta changes are replicated.
trans-unit.target: For ongoing replication only delta changes are replicated.

trans-unit.source: Site Recovery supports offline data transfer and works with WAN optimizers.
trans-unit.target: Site Recovery supports offline data transfer and works with WAN optimizers.

trans-unit.source: Pricing-You can Read more about Site Recovery pricing.
trans-unit.target: Pricing-You can Read more about Site Recovery pricing.

trans-unit.source: This table summarizes the replication scenarios supported by Site Recovery.
trans-unit.target: This table summarizes the replication scenarios supported by Site Recovery.

trans-unit.source: Replicate virtual machine on one or more on-premises Hyper-V host servers that are defined as a Hyper-V site to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Replicate virtual machine on one or more on-premises Hyper-V host servers that are defined as a Hyper-V site to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Replicate virtual machines on one or more on-premises Hyper-V host servers located in a VMM cloud to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Replicate virtual machines on one or more on-premises Hyper-V host servers located in a VMM cloud to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Replicate a physical Windows or Linux server to Azure
trans-unit.target: Replicate a physical Windows or Linux server to Azure

trans-unit.source: Replicate VMware virtual machines to Azure
trans-unit.target: Replicate VMware virtual machines to Azure

trans-unit.source: Replicate virtual machines on on-premises Hyper-V host servers located in a VMM cloud to a secondary VMM server in another datacenter
trans-unit.target: Replicate virtual machines on on-premises Hyper-V host servers located in a VMM cloud to a secondary VMM server in another datacenter

trans-unit.source: Replicate virtual machines on on-premises Hyper-V host servers located in a VMM cloud to a secondary VMM server in another datacenter using SAN replication
trans-unit.target: Replicate virtual machines on on-premises Hyper-V host servers located in a VMM cloud to a secondary VMM server in another datacenter using SAN replication

trans-unit.source: Replicate virtual machines on on-premises Hyper-V host servers located in a VMM cloud to a secondary cloud on the same VMM server
trans-unit.target: Replicate virtual machines on on-premises Hyper-V host servers located in a VMM cloud to a secondary cloud on the same VMM server

trans-unit.source: ASR replication technologies are compatible with any application running in a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: ASR replication technologies are compatible with any application running in a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: We have conducted additional testing in partnership with application product teams to further support each application.
trans-unit.target: We have conducted additional testing in partnership with application product teams to further support each application.

trans-unit.source: <html></html>SAP<html></html><html></html>Replicate SAP site to Azure for non cluster<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html>SAP<html></html><html></html>Replicate SAP site to Azure for non cluster<html></html>

trans-unit.source: This table summarizes the main Site Recovery features and how they're handled during replication to Azure, replication to a secondary site using the default Hyper-V Replica replication, and using SAN.
trans-unit.target: This table summarizes the main Site Recovery features and how they're handled during replication to Azure, replication to a secondary site using the default Hyper-V Replica replication, and using SAN.

trans-unit.source: Replicate to a secondary site (Hyper-V Replica)
trans-unit.target: Replicate to a secondary site (Hyper-V Replica)

trans-unit.source: Metadata about on-premises servers and virtual machines is stored in the Site Recovery vault.<html></html> <html></html>Replicated data is stored in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: Metadata about on-premises servers and virtual machines is stored in the Site Recovery vault.<html></html> <html></html>Replicated data is stored in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: Metadata about on-premises servers and virtual machines is stored in the Site Recovery vault.<html></html> <html></html>Replicated data is stored in the location specified by the target Hyper-V server.
trans-unit.target: Metadata about on-premises servers and virtual machines is stored in the Site Recovery vault.<html></html> <html></html>Replicated data is stored in the location specified by the target Hyper-V server.

trans-unit.source: Metadata about on-premises servers and virtual machines is stored in the Site Recovery vault.<html></html> <html></html>Replicated data is stored in the target array storage.
trans-unit.target: Metadata about on-premises servers and virtual machines is stored in the Site Recovery vault.<html></html> <html></html>Replicated data is stored in the target array storage.

trans-unit.target: Azure account with the Site Recovery service

trans-unit.target: Azure account with the Site Recovery service

trans-unit.source: Replicate virtual machine from source Hyper-V host to Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: Replicate virtual machine from source Hyper-V host to Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: Fail back to the source location.
trans-unit.target: Fail back to the source location.

trans-unit.source: Replicate virtual machine from source Hyper-V host to target Hyper-V host.
trans-unit.target: Replicate virtual machine from source Hyper-V host to target Hyper-V host.

trans-unit.source: Fail back to the source location.
trans-unit.target: Fail back to the source location.

trans-unit.source: Replicate virtual machines from source SAN storage device to target SAN device.
trans-unit.target: Replicate virtual machines from source SAN storage device to target SAN device.

trans-unit.source: Fail back to the source location.
trans-unit.target: Fail back to the source location.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine hard disk stored in Azure storage
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine hard disk stored in Azure storage

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine hard disk stored on Hyper-V host
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine hard disk stored on Hyper-V host

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine hard disk stored on SAN storage array
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine hard disk stored on SAN storage array

trans-unit.source: Required to store replicated virtual machine hard disks
trans-unit.target: Required to store replicated virtual machine hard disks

trans-unit.source: SAN storage array must be available in both the source and target sites and managed by VMM
trans-unit.target: SAN storage array must be available in both the source and target sites and managed by VMM

trans-unit.source: VMM server only in the source site only.
trans-unit.target: VMM server only in the source site only.

trans-unit.source: VMM servers in source and target sites are recommended.
trans-unit.target: VMM servers in source and target sites are recommended.

trans-unit.source: You can replicate between clouds on a single VMM server.
trans-unit.target: You can replicate between clouds on a single VMM server.

trans-unit.source: VMM server in source and target VMM sites.
trans-unit.target: VMM server in source and target VMM sites.

trans-unit.source: Clouds must contain at least one Hyper-V cluster.
trans-unit.target: Clouds must contain at least one Hyper-V cluster.

trans-unit.target: Install on source and target VMM servers

trans-unit.target: Install on source and target VMM servers

trans-unit.target: Azure Recovery Services Agent<html></html><html></html>Used to connected over HTTPS to Site Recovery

trans-unit.source: Set recovery points by time.<html></html> <html></html>Specifies how long a recovery point should be kept (0-24 hours)
trans-unit.target: Set recovery points by time.<html></html> <html></html>Specifies how long a recovery point should be kept (0-24 hours)

trans-unit.source: Set recovery points by amount.<html></html> <html></html>Specifies how many additional recovery points should be kept (0-15). By default a recovery point is created every hour
trans-unit.target: Set recovery points by amount.<html></html> <html></html>Specifies how many additional recovery points should be kept (0-15). By default a recovery point is created every hour

trans-unit.source: Map VM networks to Azure networks.<html></html> <html></html>Network mapping ensures that all virtual machines that fail over in the same source VM network can connect after failover. In addition if there's a network gateway on the target Azure network then virtual machines can connect to on-premises virtual machines. <html></html><html></html>If mapping isn't enabled only virtual machines that fail over in the same recovery plan can connect to each other after failover to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Map VM networks to Azure networks.<html></html> <html></html>Network mapping ensures that all virtual machines that fail over in the same source VM network can connect after failover. In addition if there's a network gateway on the target Azure network then virtual machines can connect to on-premises virtual machines. <html></html><html></html>If mapping isn't enabled only virtual machines that fail over in the same recovery plan can connect to each other after failover to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Map source VM networks to target VM networks.<html></html> <html></html>Network mapping is used to place replicated virtual machines on optimal Hyper-V host servers, and ensures that virtual machines associated with the source VM network are associated with the mapped target network after failover. <html></html><html></html>If mapping isn't enabled replicated virtual machines won't be connected to a network.
trans-unit.target: Map source VM networks to target VM networks.<html></html> <html></html>Network mapping is used to place replicated virtual machines on optimal Hyper-V host servers, and ensures that virtual machines associated with the source VM network are associated with the mapped target network after failover. <html></html><html></html>If mapping isn't enabled replicated virtual machines won't be connected to a network.

trans-unit.source: Map source VM networks to target VM networks.<html></html> <html></html>Network mapping ensures that virtual machines associated with the source VM network are associated with the mapped target network after failover. <html></html><html></html>If mapping isn't enabled replicated virtual machines won't be connected to a network.
trans-unit.target: Map source VM networks to target VM networks.<html></html> <html></html>Network mapping ensures that virtual machines associated with the source VM network are associated with the mapped target network after failover. <html></html><html></html>If mapping isn't enabled replicated virtual machines won't be connected to a network.

trans-unit.source: Maps storage classifications on source VMM servers to storage classifications on target VMM servers.<html></html> <html></html>With mapping enable virtual machine hard disks in the source storage classification will be located in the target storage classification after failover.<html></html><html></html>If storage mapping isn't enabled replicated virtual hard disks will be stored in the default location on the target Hyper-V host server.
trans-unit.target: Maps storage classifications on source VMM servers to storage classifications on target VMM servers.<html></html> <html></html>With mapping enable virtual machine hard disks in the source storage classification will be located in the target storage classification after failover.<html></html><html></html>If storage mapping isn't enabled replicated virtual hard disks will be stored in the default location on the target Hyper-V host server.

trans-unit.source: Maps between storage arrays and pools in the primary and secondary sites.
trans-unit.target: Maps between storage arrays and pools in the primary and secondary sites.

trans-unit.target: After you're finished this overview <link><linkText>read the best practices</linkText><title></title></link> to help you get started with deployment planning.
